perturbation.original_text: 1.2 If the provisions of the agreement are inconsistent with the order, the order shall prevail. Not stated in order content will be subject to the provisions of agreement. Any modification, supplementary, give up should been written records, only to be valid by buyers and sellers authorized representative signature and confirmation, otherwise will be deemed invalid.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 If the provisions of the agreement are inconsistent with the order, the order shall prevail. Not stated in order content will be subject to the provisions of agreement. Any modification, supplementary, give up can be done verbally between the buyer and the seller. Verbal agreements are considered valid, regardless of whether they are documented in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 1.2 requires any modification, supplementary information, or relinquishment to be written and signed by authorized representatives to be valid. The revised version contradicts this by stating that verbal agreements are considered valid, regardless of written documentation. This creates uncertainty because it's unclear whether a verbal agreement is sufficient to modify the contract.

perturbation.original_text: 2.2 The seller shall be confirmed within three working days after receipt of order. If the seller finds order is not acceptable or need to modify, should note entrusted party in two working days after receipt of the order, If the seller did not confirm orders in time or notice not accept orders or modifications, the seller is deemed to have been accepted the order. The orders become effective once the seller accepts, any party shall not unilaterally cancel the order before the two sides agreed .
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 The seller shall be confirmed within three working days after receipt of order. If the seller finds order is not acceptable or need to modify, should note entrusted party in two working days after receipt of the order, If the seller did not confirm orders in time or notice not accept orders or modifications, the seller is deemed to have been accepted the order. The orders become effective once the seller accepts, any party can unilaterally cancel the order with no penalty.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 2.2 stated that once an order is accepted by the seller, neither party can unilaterally cancel the order before both parties agree. The modified clause states that any party can unilaterally cancel the order with no penalty, directly contradicting the prior statement. This creates uncertainty regarding the order's cancellation policy and potentially leads to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 23. The Contract is valid for 5 years, beginning from and ended on . This Contract is made out in three originals in both Chinese and English, each language being legally of the equal effect. Conflicts between these two languages arising there from, if any, shall be subject to Chinese version. One copy for the Sellers, two copies for the Buyers. The Contract becomes effective after signed by both parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 23. The Contract is valid for 5 years, beginning from and ended on . This Contract is made out in three originals in both Chinese and English, the English language shall be legally binding. Conflicts between these two languages arising there from, if any, shall be subject to English version. One copy for the Sellers, two copies for the Buyers. The Contract becomes effective after signed by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 23 states that both the Chinese and English versions of the contract have equal legal effect, and any conflicts between the two shall be subject to the Chinese version. The modified version contradicts this by asserting that the English language is legally binding, and any conflicts shall be subject to the English version. This creates a conflict between the two versions of the agreement, which creates uncertainty.
